Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.0]. 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.5]. 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.5, 0.5], End Point [0.375, 0.5]. 4. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.75 units along the normal direction and 0 units along the opposite direction of the normal to create the base prism. Next, extrude a circular hole through the prism (based on the final shape's description). To do so, create a circular sketch on a plane perpendicular to the prism's longest edges, using the midpoints of the lines that form the longer edges as the center of the circle. Set the radius of the circle based on the hole's diameter and extrude it partially through the prism. The result is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a central, circular hole. The length and width correspond to the overall dimensions of the prism—0.75 units and 0.5 units, respectively. The height matches the thickness of the extruded prism—0.5 units.</description>
